result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawntel Denise Hayes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit a DNA sample; pay DNA surcharge. Pay costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawntel Denise Hayes

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Case passed to allow the State time to contact the victim.

BACK ON THE RECORD.  SAME APPEARANCES.
TAPE# 11:13
Court granted state's motion for adjournment of sentencing to allow victim to be notified.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 4.

Defendant Shawntel Denise Hayes in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to DISORDERLY CONDUCT - WHILE ARMED, contrary to Wis. Stats. Sec. 947.01 and 939.63(1)(b), a Class B Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shawntel Denise Hayes in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shawntel Denise Hayes in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Dontrell H.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shawntel Denise Hayes in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Shawntel Denise Hayes in custody.  
William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 21.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  

Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
